definition: (of a performer) to come onto the stage to perform/(of an athlete) to enter the arena to compete/(fig.) to enter the scene (e.g. a new product)/(of an examinee etc) to leave the venue

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout
appearance fee
(of a referee) to send a player off the field

sentences.english: With the formal suits but humorous gestures, the Chorale made their first appearance.
sentences.chinese: 正式的着裝，詼諧的動作，是該合唱團的出場秀。

sentences.english: In addition, with Gio arts Chiellini may not be able to play.
sentences.chinese: 除此之外，基耶利尼同吉奧文科也未必能夠出場。

sentences.english: Butler right knee injury. Will not return tonight.
sentences.chinese: 巴特勒右膝蓋受傷，今天晚上不會重新出場了。

sentences.english: Aquilani scored twice in 33 league appearances for Juventus last season.
sentences.chinese: 上賽季代表尤文聯賽出場33次，進了兩個球。

sentences.english: He spent much of last season on loan at Tottenham Hotspur (he moved to White Hart Lane when the Reds bought Dimitar Berbatov) where he made 21 appearances.
sentences.chinese: 他上賽季大部分時間都在熱刺租借，出場21次。

sentences.english: Imps ? Didn't really change at all, though they don't really need to much.
sentences.chinese: 小鬼？完全不用改變它，雖然它的出場率很低。

sentences.english: Okur and Kirilenko both fouled out in the final minute.
sentences.chinese: 在最後時刻奧庫和基裏連科雙雙被罰出場。

sentences.english: And you once fouled because of striking.
sentences.chinese: 你有一次曾因爲打人犯規而被罰出場外。

sentences.english: Oft-injured Larry Hughes should get more playing time in Pavlovic's absence.
sentences.chinese: 傷病常客休斯應該會得到更多的出場時間。

sentences.english: Checks that the starting list for the qualification round is correct.
sentences.chinese: 檢查資格賽的出場序是否正確。

sentences.english: But his past scoring record is impressive.
sentences.chinese: 但是他過去代表尤文出場的戰績卻令人印象深刻。

sentences.english: The centre forward of our school team was sent off the field by the referee for roughing.
sentences.chinese: 我們校隊的中鋒因動作粗野被裁判判罰出場。

sentences.english: Tomasz Kuszczak, meanwhile, is expected to receive a run-out against Wolverhampton Wanderers in the Carling Cup tomorrow night.
sentences.chinese: 同時，庫什薩克也將在週三的聯賽盃上得到出場機會。

sentences.english: What if an ad coes in at exactly the same time as a chat ?
sentences.chinese: 那如果廣告作爲一個新的聊天訊息出場的話呢？

sentences.english: Approves and signs the starting lists for the next round.
sentences.chinese: 認可並簽署簽名下一場比賽出場序。

sentences.english: Gareth made 45 appearances for Southampton, scoring five goals.
sentences.chinese: 貝爾爲南安普頓出場45次，並有5粒進球。

definition: to go on stage/fig. to appear on the scene/used in advertising to mean new product
to show oneself/to appear/(of a deity) to appear in the flesh
to begin/to open/to start/beginning of an event
scene/spectacle/occasion/situation
gorgeous
everyone present/the whole audience/across-the-board/unanimously/whole duration (of a competition or match)
confrontation/contest/showdown
public/to publish/to make public
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout
to be present/to be on the scene
competition (sports etc)/match/CL:場|场[chang3],次[ci4]/to compete
to enter the venue/to enter the arena/(aviation) to approach the airfield/(investing) to get into the market
to hold a governmental office or post/to assume office of/to take charge of/to serve as
bean vermicelli/mung bean starch noodles/Chinese vermicelli/cellophane noodles/CL:把[ba3]/fan (loanword)/enthusiast for sb or sth
to see
the scene (of a crime, accident etc)/(on) the spot/(at) the site
